ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The skills I gained were quite clear because I started the semester as a complete beginner. Now I am able to speak a fair amount of french and write it even better.
I learned a lot of French for someone who is a beginner in the language. I learned how to read, write, speak, and understand French.
I learned more French than I could have ever hoped to learn in just a few months.
This course gave me a solid foundation in basic French grammar and vocabulary.
My professor was wonderful.
I learned French
At the end of the semester I was surprised as to how much French I learned. You learn basic and intermediate grammar and a wide range of vocabulary through the French in Action method.

I learned not only the language but a lot about the French culture through the French in Action series. I learned probably more French in this semester than I did with Spanish in three years in high school.
I learned a significant amount of French in one semester.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: My strength is my writing ability for french. Having come from several years of latin I have gotten good at memorizing rules, verb forms, etc. My weakness is my speaking ability.
I think a weakness was that not everything built on one another so it was easy to forget some stuff you learned.
French In Action can seem outdated and sexist at times, but it is nonetheless an effective method of learning French.
That this course occurs daily means students are constantly able to practice and hone their language skills.
I like the class. But the work is too much.
It was very intensive, which was good, but someone's too intensive
There is a very strong structure behind this course. I find the "French in Action" method to be very successful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning french and who is willing to put in a lot of work. This class was not easy, but it succeeded in teaching me a fair amount.
Definitely take if you have an interest in learning French.
I would recommend this course if you REALLY want to learn French. It is A LOT of work. That said, you will learn more than you could imagine learning in just a few months.
Absolutely recommend this course to anybody who wishes to learn French. The French department at Yale really is fantastic.
Absolutely, but be prepared for lots of work.
I would if someone was very interested in learning French, but not someone looking for a walk in the park
Yes! Amazing teacher- Prof. Carole Delaitre
If you are interested in learning French, I would highly recommend taking this course.
